h2_title: Commander Beetle Boss Fight and Guide
img_above_text:
# Commander Beetle

The Commander Beetle is an optional Yaoguai Chief boss fight that you can find during Chapter 4 of Black Myth Wukong. Located between the Forest of Ferocity and the Temple Entrance itself, this boss trains a group of Daoists who will all try to stop you.

* Rewards: Commander Beetle Spirit, Knot of Voidness, Refined Iron Sand, 1562 Experience, 1434 Will


The Commander Beetle is an optional boss -- though hard to miss as you explore the Temple of Yellow Flowers. From the Forest of Ferocity Shrine, you need only make your way along the main path and up the stairs to find a large courtyard where the boss trains a group of several Sword Daoists.

## Commander Beetle Boss Fight and Guide

As mentioned previously, the Commander Beetle can also perform of series of sword slams with his bigger left sword. The small line that extends from his strike won't look like much for a moment, until a large fissure erupts from the path of his weapon which he can do several times in a row.
img_below_text: Even when not slamming the ground, his bigger sword can also cut through the air to send a slicing wave of force at you from a distance, which comes out much faster than his slams, and can be done multiple times.

img_summary:
Preceding Text Summary:
The preceding text introduces the Commander Beetle, an optional boss in *Black Myth: Wukong*, encountered in Chapter 4 between the Forest of Ferocity and the Temple Entrance. The boss trains a group of Sword Daoists and rewards players with items and experience upon defeat. It highlights the boss's sword-based attacks, including ground slams that create fissures.

Image Summary:
The image depicts the Commander Beetle boss fight in a courtyard setting. A bright, vertical wave of force is shown cutting through the air, likely representing one of the boss's sword attacks described in the text. The player character is visible in combat stance, with health and ability indicators displayed on the screen. The environment includes traditional architecture and natural elements, consistent with the Temple Entrance location.

Following Text Summary:
The following text elaborates on the Commander Beetle's ranged sword attack, which sends fast slicing waves of force through the air. These attacks are quicker than the ground slams and can be performed multiple times, adding complexity to the fight.
